last_comment:
Look at Tesla's 2019 quarterly revenue: 3/31/2019 at 4.5B, 6/30/2019 6,3B (added 1.8B from first to second quarters)
This year it dropped 1.4B from 7.3B (12/30/2019) to 5,9B on 3/31/2020
With remaining downtrend, because of COVID (-1.4B), and historical uptrend of +1.8B, the best bullish
case for Tesla would be to report revenue of 5.9+0.4= 6.3B (same as last year for 6/30)
Last year the third quarter stayed as 6.3B. So AT BEST we are looking at stagnant SAME as last year
this and next quarter revenues.
What warrants the $966 a share price when same (looking forward) 6 months period of last year the stock (correlated to revenue) was traded at a third of a current valuation?

GLCRFJBGKS4PUB6LAONQOOD424.body:
Thank you President Obama - 

 ((((    Reversing a ban on oil drilling off most U.S. shores, President Barack Obama on Wednesday announced an expansive new policy that could put new oil and natural gas platforms in waters along the southern Atlantic coastline, the eastern Gulf of Mexico and part of Alaska.       )))))

  Lets not forget that President Obama is responsible for some of the oil coming online today.

SKX7ZFGOYC2XW5CNWSN4JKCZ34.body:
A note of caution for TSLA investors:
Opposition to the vision regarding universal adoption of battery electric vehicles shouldn’t be seen as an attack on TSLA.
At least in my case, I recognize the present trend toward adoption of EVs, but I see a very large CAUTION sign around the trend being universal.

Many modern ICEVs get 30 plus mpg, fill their tank in less than two minutes, and don’t worry about fuel for several weeks.  No range anxiety, no daily concern about how much charge remains, no phantom discharge, no search for charging facility,  no
Inconvenient time lost waiting for the charge.  There’s even reports that some supercharge rates are on a par with gasoline cost per mile, and who’s to say those rates won’t increase in the future as the UNIVERSAL VISION doesn’t pan out as TSLAphiles predict.  There’s far more uncertainties along these lines than TSLA bulls choose to address.

Let’s face facts, competition in the EV sector is growing.  Only a naive investor believes TSLA is the one car company that has all the answered to dominate the transportation vehicle sector, and that’s the way TSLA stock is presently valued.

42NNKYG27ERI5BWIQBKN6XNR64.body: Everyone should urinate in a Tesla autonomous taxi.

  Both factories paid for by others.

Berlin and Houston gets their running all the tesla lovers well go

3HUE3R2UNLEDJKYL3MSLEIVAFM.body:
I posted this reply the other day to a really dumb tsla bull post and is worth sharing here, just for fun:

I never short ANY stock, ever.  tsla stinks to high heaven regardless of the shorty's out there!

P.S. learn to read the financials of this lousy company. THEY MAKE NO $$ ON THE AUTOMOTIVE BUSINESS. No, no, don't even THINK of bringing up the "credits" because that won't be lasting much longer. I can guarantee that.

P.S.S. I hope too you saw the JDP IQS reports just released? tsla = DEAD LAST in initial quality. The automotive business is harder than rocket science and tsla has NOTHING to do with SpaceX.

This is fun.

GKTQ5XG6ZQR4ZX5PSZXGAMMWTQ.body:
Red Alert Red Alert - Covid Spike is a hoax...... the way they are reading the statistics is irresponsible and a hoax that even cought the Florida Governor by surprise. It trully amazes me, when people take for granted with someone else said.

I remember some knotty boys giving competitors the wrong date and time for meeting.

mmmmm. we are now doing that in reporting.... Corona relapse is a hoax it is because they have changed the way they count. The used the stated wide count that I takes the highest incidence at a particular place and counts that, what happens is that you can fudge the numbers by simply diverting traffic to a specific hospital and voila you get the spiked numbers 

This is the rumor going around..... any truth to it? lots I think.... PASS THIS ALONG

HNV34YSVLO5HZ2N3NELQ4DPNLI.body:
Look at Tesla's 2019 quarterly revenue: 3/31/2019 at 4.5B, 6/30/2019 6,3B (added 1.8B from first to second quarters)
This year it dropped 1.4B from 7.3B (12/30/2019) to 5,9B on 3/31/2020
With remaining downtrend, because of COVID (-1.4B), and historical uptrend of +1.8B, the best bullish
case for Tesla would be to report revenue of 5.9+0.4= 6.3B (same as last year for 6/30)
Last year the third quarter stayed as 6.3B. So AT BEST we are looking at stagnant SAME as last year
this and next quarter revenues.
What warrants the $966 a share price when same (looking forward) 6 months period of last year the stock (correlated to revenue) was traded at a third of a current valuation?

SKX7ZFGOYC2XW5CNWSN4JKCZ34.body:
A note of caution for TSLA investors:
Opposition to the vision regarding universal adoption of battery electric vehicles shouldn’t be seen as an attack on TSLA.
At least in my case, I recognize the present trend toward adoption of EVs, but I see a very large CAUTION sign around the trend being universal.

Many modern ICEVs get 30 plus mpg, fill their tank in less than two minutes, and don’t worry about fuel for several weeks.  No range anxiety, no daily concern about how much charge remains, no phantom discharge, no search for charging facility,  no
Inconvenient time lost waiting for the charge.  There’s even reports that some supercharge rates are on a par with gasoline cost per mile, and who’s to say those rates won’t increase in the future as the UNIVERSAL VISION doesn’t pan out as TSLAphiles predict.  There’s far more uncertainties along these lines than TSLA bulls choose to address.

Let’s face facts, competition in the EV sector is growing.  Only a naive investor believes TSLA is the one car company that has all the answered to dominate the transportation vehicle sector, and that’s the way TSLA stock is presently valued.

AOL7TIQA2MCW6J63CLUK6COVSI.body:
Moment of truth for TSLA shareholders:
Do you hold through the weekend?
Riots, shutdowns, bankruptcies...this is going to be the norm overnight and over weekends for months going forward.  If you think things are going to be rosy for the next year, you have your head buried in the sand.
You will look at futures on Monday down 5% and say, oh it will recover.  People always buy the dips.  Then it happens again and again.  Yes, there will be 10% pops among the red distribution days as the buyers buy the dips hoping for $1000.  We are in a bear market.  You are in a highly speculative overbought stock in that bear market.  Prepare yourselves.  Think this cannot go to $100?  Think again.  NOTHING is safe, preserve capital and buy defensive names if you buy anything.

MNVYTPWWGRDYXDWZ25SHRKSI74.body: Seems like some big move is about to happen.  Stock is just hovering around 1000, with super low volumes.  Usually this happens when a stock is about to make some corrective move in the opposite direction of the most recent trend.  Reversion to the mean is almost a universal.  QQQ at all time high and SPY and DIA  still 8-10% off their respective ATHs.  Tesla 50-day MA at 838 & 200-day MA at 547.  Only 16mm shares short 10% of float versus almost 30% within past year.  Looks like the right time for a healthy pull-back to the low to mid 800s, at least.

I think tesla is really going back to 650 but for different reasons.

1. I think old big dog rich money that always has a few certain analysts ears wants tsla to put in a strong bottom base of at least 700
 They say 650, but although could go to 600 for a day if covid keeps getting worse. I think morgan stanley wants 700 at least. Might be the last chance to get their old money clients another whack at 700.

But from then, I believe they park nkla at a 100 billion cap & give the all clear for the run to start in october towards 2000 after battery day which has the risk at least of not being that great.

Anybody could have guessed 650 after tsla went what? 400 in march.

I believe the future involves tsla and nkla trying to 1 up each other.

I expect a smaller factory for nkla with a wilder design, lights everywhere, possibly not as many robotic assemblers, fancier lighting, more attractive insides than even tsla.

Tsla gets morgan stanley and goldman downgrading tesla, but neither will upgrade dkng nkla or igt, cramer hyped penn at least.

The fact nobody stuck their neck out on wtrh food and grocery delivery with the covid surge is like they are all slacking. Last earnings report for wtrh was 100% positive.

I do not know what to think of ford but we will know soon.
